instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00164: What is 820-00164? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U6100: What is U6100? this is an SPI ROM chip that holds the BIOS which is necessary for the machine to POST or try and power on..
definitions.SMC_LID: What is SMC_LID? SMC_LID tells the machine the system is open when it is 3.3v to 3.4v, and closed when it is low such as 0v-0.6v. When this signal is low, the machine may go to sleep or have no backlight. .
definitions.PPVRTC_G3H: What is PPVRTC_G3H? PPVRTC_G3H is a 3.3v power rail for the RTC circuit present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state. .
definitions.PLT_RESET_L: What is PLT_RESET_L? PLT_RESET_L is platform reset, this signal keeps the system from POSTing. _L means the signal is asserted when its voltage is low. .
definitions.RTC_RESET_L: What is RTC_RESET_L? RTC_RESET_L is a reset signal that is present when the signal is low, the _L means it is asserted when the voltage is low. The RESET signal will keep the PCH from turning on or booting up the machine. .
definitions.PM_PCH_PWROK: What is PM_PCH_PWROK? PM_PCH_PWROK is usually created by U1950, a 74LVC2G08GT chip and is necessary for the machine to wake from an S5 and S4 state and turn on. This signal will be present if ALL_SYS_PWRGD, CPU_VR_PGOOD, PP3V3_S0, and PP3V42_G3H are present. When this signal is not present or intermittent, usually pin 8 on U1950 for PP3V42_G3H is corroded..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Fan spin butdont comes up, no dong no display
threads.message:
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> board dont show a display no dong
i have the usb tester A4551 from chipmunk shows 2 red leds but the green one is not do anything

<SIGNAL>BT_PWRRESET_L</SIGNAL>  3.3V
<SIGNAL>PM_PCH_SYS_PWROK</SIGNAL> 3.41V
<SIGNAL>PM_PCH_PWROK</SIGNAL> 3.41
<SIGNAL>RTC_RESET_L</SIGNAL> is 3.31V
<SIGNAL>PPVRTC_G3H</SIGNAL> is 3.33V
<SIGNAL>PCH_CLK32K_RTCX1</SIGNAL> has a nice 32.7 puls
under infrared cpu is getting warm 46 Â°C
<SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> is 3.38V
CPU VCORE is 1.8V
<SIGNAL>PLT_RESET_L</SIGNAL> is 3.3 V

I checked all SPI bus SerieTermination resistors for value, they are all 22 ok in value
<CHIP>U6100</CHIP> get on pin 8 3.3V


i have no idea what to test next

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Fan spin butdont comes up, no dong no display
threads.message:
Any history available, liquid sign?

Did you try known good BIOS?
Just in case, try PRAM reset.
Disconnect internal SSD, airport card, trackpad, webcam and LCD.
Test the board alone on the desk; even without LIO flex.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Fan spin butdont comes up, no dong no display
threads.message:
yes, just now tryed a bios from vinafix ([URL]https://vinafix.com/threads/j110-<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-051-00384.20625/[/URL])
 but same, but i dont know if the bios is good

i have the board only with the dcin connected on the desk, no lio flex

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Fan spin butdont comes up, no dong no display
threads.message: i dont found any liquid signs

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Fan spin butdont comes up, no dong no display
threads.message:
Man, don't waste time with Vinafix BIOSes.
Your problem may not be the BIOS, but try something better, not Vinafix...

Did you test LIO USB port too?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Fan spin butdont comes up, no dong no display
threads.message:
okay.
so now i conected the lio flex and tryed the lio usb, same result coming up the 2 red leds and thats it

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Fan spin butdont comes up, no dong no display
threads.message:
Try this BIOS, just in case.
[URL unfurl="true"]https://drive.google.com/file/d/1aa_HXgexiqTkSDil3f-l2vE84-D-XDFr/view?usp=sharing[/URL]

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Fan spin butdont comes up, no dong no display
threads.message:
yes man that worked. ! thanks a lot.
the problem was definitly the bios. but with your bios i had the same result. it was a little hard to me to solder the bios chip good with the board. so when i had the same result with your now known good bios i tryed some times to solder that good and now its working.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Fan spin butdont comes up, no dong no display
threads.message:
back again with bad news

i assembled today all together, came the client, machine starting up and shut down or freez. after 3-4 times tryed i have now the same problem like in the beginning, fan spins, cpu vcore is good, it pulls only until 0.5A if good it should until 0.6 I think. seems like no brain.

so i desoldered the bios chip, take a known working one, flsh it with the <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> GFEIN clean ME OK.rar 
to be shure that it is good soldered I glued it upside down, and soldered 9 wires from chip to board.

there is still the same problem.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Fan spin butdont comes up, no dong no display
threads.message:
Solder the chip in correct position.
Check all its traces and SPI resistors.
There could be an issue caused by crap accumlated under some BGA chip.
